content.content: Introduction Welcome to the fifth edition of the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round-Up. This summary aims to introduce the successful governance authors and initiatives during the month of October. It also serves as an overview where members of the Maker Community can follow up on the new governance proposals submitted throughout the month. The Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Initiative aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. In this way, GovAlpha continues to search for alternative mechanisms to strengthen our governance process through the direct incentive of concrete governance actions, encouraging community members to trigger governance processes with tangible results.  Announcements Starting this month, GovAlpha will only reward the authoring of new Signal Requests that comply with the recently ratified MIP4c2-SP27: MIP Amendment Subproposal, which states that to protect the integrity of existing MIPs, Signals are only allowed if they are explicitly triggered and required by an existing MIP. This component explicitly prohibits the possibility of community-triggered Signals on any topic. It also explicitly states that the only way to make arbitrary changes to Maker Governance is through the full MIP process or Governance Mandates from Mandated Actors. However, we will maintain bounties for all existing pre MIP4c2-SP27: MIP Amendment Subproposal ratification Signals that have been positively voted by the community. If there is anything else you would like to see added, please send me a message or leave a comment below.  The Bounty The bounty consists of a pool of 6,000 DAI per month to be distributed among all successful MakerDAO governance proposals.  Eligible Proposal Types Proposals eligible for rewards are:  Successful MIP proposals Successful MIP Subproposals Successful Signal Requests  A proposal is considered successful if its on-chain vote meets the success criteria defined in the accompanying on-chain poll text.  Rewards The maximum reward for each type of successful proposal is denoted below.  MIP - 2,000 DAI Subproposal - 1,000 DAI Signal - 500 DAI  The reward pool for a given month is split between proposals according to the following weights.  MIP = 1 Subproposal = 1/2 Signal = ¼   Exclusions Proposals concerning collateral onboarding are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Proposals requesting funds from the Maker Protocol are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Core Unit members are not eligible to receive off-chain proposal bounties. This includes Core Unit Facilitators.  Eligible Successful Proposals in October This month we have two different eligible successful proposals. On this occasion, two new sub-proposals within the MIP41: Facilitator Framework challenge and transform different aspects of the DAO’s interaction with its decentralized workforce. @Codeknight proposed MIP4c2-SP26: Facilitator Offboarding Process (MIP41c5) adjustments with the objective of streamlining the exit process for Facilitators offboarded by governance. After a month of RFC discussion, the proposal entered the October Governance Cycle and was approved with 58.39% positive votes backed by 46,107 MKR. On the other hand, @ultraschuppi was the author of the subproposal MIP41c5-SP12: Facilitator Offboarding (RWF-001). In order to ensure that the protocol meets its obligations to external stakeholders, it proposed that the RWF-001 Facilitator be relieved of his duties as a mandated actor and head of the RWF-001 Core Unit. The proposal entered the October Governance Cycle and was approved with 96.07% positive votes backed by 75,891 MKR Both subproposals have been rewarded with a bounty of 1000 DAI each. Finally, Rune has elected to waive the bounty for the Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set and Core Unit offboarding proposals. To learn more about the process of amending and removing Maker Improvement Proposals please visit this link.  October Stats  Polls & Executives In October, twenty-one Governance Polls and four Executive Votes were published to the voting portal.   Governance Proposals Three Signal Requests were put to a vote whereas four Mip proposals and eleven Subproposals have passed the formal submission window and have entered the Governance Cycle as a ratification polls.   October Successful Governance Proposals The following proposals were favorably voted during last month.  Signals     Type Proposal Author     Signal Request [Signal Request] MIP65 Asset Reallocation @Allan_Pedersen     MIPs & Subproposals     Type Proposal Author     MIP MIP81: Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards @CB_Institutional   MIP MIP82: Monetalis/Coinbase Appaloosa @Allan_Pedersen   MIP MIP83: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters @rune   MIP MIP84: Activate Protocol-Owned Vault Emulation @rune   Subproposal MIP4c2-SP26: Facilitator Offboarding Process (MIP41c5) adjustments @CodeKnight   Subproposal MIP41c5-SP12: Facilitator Offboarding (RWF-001) @ultraschuppi   Subproposal MIP55c3-SP9: Legal & Risk Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral BlockTower Credit (RWA Arranger) @Aes   Subproposal MIP39c3-SP3: Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) @rune   Subproposal MIP39c3-SP4: Offboarding the Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) @rune   Subproposal MIP39c3-SP5: Offboarding the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001) @rune   Subproposal MIP1c4-SP1: Subproposal for Changing the Problem Space @rune   Subproposal MIP4c2-SP27: MIP Amendment Subproposals @rune   Subproposal MIP39c2-SP35: Modifying Risk Core Unit Mandate - RISK-001 @rune   Subproposal MIP39c2-SP36: Modifying Strategic Finance Core Unit Mandate (SF-001) @rune   Subproposal MIP39c2-SP37: Modifying Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit Mandate (CES-001) @rune     October Eligible Governance Proposals This month, in addition to the two successful Suproposals, two eligible Signals were put to the vote. One of them has been withdrawn, although the other passed during November, so the author will recieve his bounty at the end of the month.  If you want to track the course of eligible proposals, you can do so through the Proposal Bounties Tracker.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an introduction to the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round-Up, which aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. The post explains the bounty, eligible proposal types, rewards, exclusions, and provides stats on the successful governance proposals in October. The post also announces the new rules for Signal Requests and the eligible successful proposals in October.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

Introduction Welcome to the third edition of the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round-Up. This summary aims to introduce the successful governance authors and initiatives during the month of August. It also serves as an overview where members of the Maker Community can follow up on the new governance proposals submitted throughout the month. The Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Initiative aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. In this way, GovAlpha continues to search for alternative mechanisms to strengthen our governance process through the direct incentive of concrete governance actions, encouraging community members to trigger governance processes with tangible results. If there is anything else you would like to see added, please send me a message or leave a comment below.  The Bounty The bounty consists of a pool of 6,000 DAI per month to be distributed among all successful MakerDAO governance proposals.  Eligible Proposal Types Proposals eligible for rewards are:  Successful MIP proposals Successful MIP Subproposals Successful Signal Requests  A proposal is considered successful if its on-chain vote meets the success criteria defined in the accompanying on-chain poll text.  Rewards The maximum reward for each type of successful proposal is denoted below.  MIP - 2,000 DAI Subproposal - 1,000 DAI Signal - 500 DAI  The reward pool for a given month is split between proposals according to the following weights.  MIP = 1 Subproposal = 1/2 Signal = ¼   Exclusions Proposals concerning collateral onboarding are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Proposals requesting funds from the Maker Protocol are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Core Unit members are not eligible to receive off-chain proposal bounties. This includes Core Unit Facilitators.  Eligible Successful Proposals in August This month we have our first eligible successful proposal. With the motivation to simplify and clarify the Core Unit offboarding process and to make it more transparent and orderly, Recognized Delegate @twblack88 brought the MIP4c2-SP15: Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments to the community. After several months of constructive RFC discussion, the proposal entered the August Governance Cycle and was approved with 86% positive votes backed by 86,018 MKR. Congratulations to the author and well deserved bountie of 1000 DAI! To find out more about this proposal, you can visit the following link. To learn more about the process of amending and removing Maker Improvement Proposals please visit this link.  August Stats  Polls & Executives In August, eighteen Governance Polls and four Executive Votes were published to the voting portal.   Governance Proposals Five Signal Requests were put to a vote whereas one MIP proposal and five Subproposals have passed the formal submission window and have entered the Governance Cycle as a ratification poll.   August Successful Governance Proposals The following proposals were favorably voted during last month. Only one of these proposals was eligible as the vast majority of them were either made by a CU member, or regard requesting funds from the Maker Protocol, both of which are exclusion criteria.  Signals     Type Proposal Author     Signal Request  [SIGNAL REQUEST] Budget Re-allocation & Core Unit Accountability Framework @pipko     MIPs & Subproposals     Type Proposal Author     MIP MIP76: Makershire Redux @Aes   Subproposal MIP40c3-SP75: Modify Oracles Core Unit Budget, ORA-001 @NikKunkel   Subproposal MIP40c3-SP74: Modify Dai Foundation Core Unit Budget (DAIF-001) @sorenpeter   Subproposal MIP4c2-SP23: MIP50 Direct Deposit Module Amendment @hexonaut   Subproposal MIP4c2-SP15: Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments @twblack88     August Eligible Governance Proposals This month, in addition to the successful Suproposal,  two eligible Signals were put to the vote. Neither of them met the success criteria to be rewarded.  If you want to track the course of eligible proposals, you can do so through the Proposal Bounties Tracker.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an introduction to the successful governance authors and initiatives during the month of August for the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Initiative. The initiative aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. The post also provides information on the bounty, eligible proposal types, rewards, exclusions, and eligible successful proposals in August.

content.content: This is the great way to increase the participation in the governance.
Great initiative but what factors are considered while calculating these proposals.

The proposals have their own processes determined by governance to be proposed and evaluated. The proposal bounties simply establish a pool of rewards with certain eligibility and success criteria to directly encourage the community in general to use them.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round Up #4   Introduction Welcome to the fourth edition of the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round-Up. This summary aims to introduce the successful governance authors and initiatives during the month of September. It also serves as an overview where members of the Maker Community can follow up on the new governance proposals submitted throughout the month. The Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Initiative aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. In this way, GovAlpha continues to search for alternative mechanisms to strengthen our governance process through the direct incentive of concrete governance actions, encouraging community members to trigger governance processes with tangible results. If there is anything else you would like to see added, please send me a message or leave a comment below.  The Bounty The bounty consists of a pool of 6,000 DAI per month to be distributed among all successful MakerDAO governance proposals.  Eligible Proposal Types Proposals eligible for rewards are:  Successful MIP proposals Successful MIP Subproposals Successful Signal Requests  A proposal is considered successful if its on-chain vote meets the success criteria defined in the accompanying on-chain poll text.  Rewards The maximum reward for each type of successful proposal is denoted below.  MIP - 2,000 DAI Subproposal - 1,000 DAI Signal - 500 DAI  The reward pool for a given month is split between proposals according to the following weights.  MIP = 1 Subproposal = 1/2 Signal = ¼   Exclusions Proposals concerning collateral onboarding are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Proposals requesting funds from the Maker Protocol are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Core Unit members are not eligible to receive off-chain proposal bounties. This includes Core Unit Facilitators.  Eligible Successful Proposals in September This month we have our second eligible successful proposal. With the intention of shortening the feedback loop for delegate participation, a key variable in their compensation calculation, making it more practical and fair for new delegates, @GFXlabs has brought us MIP4c2-SP24: Amend Measurement Period For Delegate Participation Metrics subproposal to the community. After a month of RFC discussion, the proposal entered the September Governance Cycle and was approved with 100% positive votes backed by 91,179 MKR. Congratulations and well deserved bountie of 1000 DAI! To find out more about this proposal, you can visit the following link. To learn more about the process of amending and removing Maker Improvement Proposals please visit this link.  September Stats  Polls & Executives In September, sixteen Governance Polls and three Executive Votes were published to the voting portal.   Governance Proposals Four Signal Requests were put to a vote whereas three Mip proposals and five Subproposals have passed the formal submission window and have entered the Governance Cycle as a ratification polls.   September Successful Governance Proposals The following proposals were favorably voted during last month. Only one of these proposals was eligible as the vast majority of them were either made by a CU member, or regard requesting funds from the Maker Protocol, both of which are exclusion criteria.  Signals     Type Proposal Author     Signal Request  [Signal Request] Change PSM-GUSD-A parameters @SebVentures   Signal Request [Signal Request] Modify D3M Guidance for MOMC @monet-supply   Signal Request [Signal Request] Create a Multisig to manage the $VELO veNFT @Aes     MIPs & Subproposals     Type Proposal Author     Subproposal MIP4c2-SP24: Amend Measurement Period For Delegate Participation Metrics @GFXlabs   Subproposal MIP55c3-SP7: Special Purpose Fund for The Ambassador Program @kat   Subproposal MIP40c3-SP80: Modify GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget - Q3 2022 @prose11   Subproposal MIP40c3-SP79: MKR Compensation for StarkNet Engineering Core Unit (SNE-001) @pyramidmaker     September Eligible Governance Proposals This month, in addition to the successful Suproposal, another eligible Subproposal and one Signal were put to the vote. One of them was unsuccessful, and the other one has been withdrawn.  If you want to track the course of eligible proposals, you can do so through the Proposal Bounties Tracker.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an update on the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Initiative, which aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. The post provides information on the bounty, eligible proposal types, rewards, exclusions, and successful proposals in September. It also invites feedback and comments from the community.

Introduction Welcome to the first edition of the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round-Up. This summary aims to introduce the winning governance authors and initiatives during the month of June. It also serves as an overview where members of the Maker Community can follow up on the new governance proposals submitted throughout the month. The Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Initiative aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and SubMIPs favorably voted by Maker Governance. In this way, GovAlpha continues to search for alternative mechanisms to strengthen our governance process through the direct incentive of concrete governance actions, encouraging community members to trigger governance processes with tangible results. If there is anything else you would like to see added, please send me a message or leave a comment below.  The Bounty The bounty consists of a pool of 6,000 DAI per month to be distributed among all successful MakerDAO governance proposals.  Eligible Proposal Types Proposals eligible for rewards are:  Successful MIP proposals Successful MIP Subproposals Successful Signal Requests  A proposal is considered successful if its on-chain vote meets the success criteria defined in the accompanying on-chain poll text.  Rewards The maximum reward for each type of successful proposal is denoted below.  MIP - 2,000 DAI Subproposal - 1,000 DAI Signal - 500 DAI  The reward pool for a given month is split between proposals according to the following weights.  MIP = 1 Subproposal = 1/2 Signal = ¼   Exclusions Proposals concerning collateral onboarding are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Proposals requesting funds from the Maker Protocol are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Core Unit members are not eligible to receive off-chain proposal bounties. This includes Core Unit Facilitators.  June Winners This month we had no eligible winning proposals.  June Stats  Polls & Executives In June, nineteen Governance Polls and four Executive Votes were published on the voting portal.   Governance Proposals Fourteen Signal Requests were put to the vote whereas three MIPs and eleven Subproposals have passed the formal submission window and have entered the Governance Cycle as ratification polls.   June Successful Governance Proposals The following proposals were favorably voted during the month of June. None of these proposals were eligible as they were either made by a CU member, or regarding collateral onboarding, both of which are exclusion criteria.  Signals     Type Proposal Author     Signal Request  Asset Allocation of MIP65/Clydesdale @Allan_Pedersen   Signal Request-Urgent Set Aave D3M bar to 0% @prose11   Signal Request Offboard UNI - Step 1 Setting Debt Ceiling to 0 @monkey.irish   Signal Request Offboard UNIV2DAIETH - Step 1 Setting Debt Ceiling to 0 @monkey.irish   Signal Request Offboard UNIV2WBTCETH - Step 1 Setting Debt Ceiling to 0 @monkey.irish   Signal Request Offboard UNIV2UNIETH - Step 1 Setting Debt Ceiling to 0 @monkey.irish   Signal Request Offboard UNIV2WBTCDAI - Step 1 Setting Debt Ceiling to 0 @monkey.irish     MIPs & Subproposals     Type Proposal Author     MIP MIP74: Permissionless Open Market Operations @rema   Subproposal MIP10c19-SP1: Update Oracle Expiration Time for All Oracles @NikKunkel   Subproposal MIP10c7-SP2: Modify Data Models for BTC/USD, LINK/USD, MANA/USD, USDT/USD, YFI/USD Data Model @NikKunkel   Subproposal MIP41c4-SP35: Facilitator Onboarding (DIN-001) @tadeo   Subproposal MIP4c2-SP20: MIP16 Amendments @Patrick_J     June Eligible Governance Proposals This month five Signal Requests were eligible for proposal bounties. Some of them were withdrawn and others were not successful. However, although none of them met the success criteria to be rewarded, many contributed significantly to the discussion and exchange in a context that requires more and more debate of ideas.  If you want to track the course of eligible proposals, you can do so through the Proposal Bounties Tracker.

It also lists the successful governance proposals and eligible proposals for the month of June. The post invites feedback and comments from the readers.

Introduction Welcome to the sixth edition of the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round-Up. This summary aims to introduce the successful governance authors and initiatives during the month of November. It also serves as an overview where members of the Maker Community can follow up on the new governance proposals submitted throughout the month. The Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Initiative aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. In this way, GovAlpha continues to search for alternative mechanisms to strengthen our governance process through the direct incentive of concrete governance actions, encouraging community members to trigger governance processes with tangible results. If there is anything else you would like to see added, please send me a message or leave a comment below.  The Bounty The bounty consists of a pool of 6,000 DAI per month to be distributed among all successful MakerDAO governance proposals.  Eligible Proposal Types Proposals eligible for rewards are:  Successful MIP proposals Successful MIP Subproposals Successful Signal Requests  A proposal is considered successful if its on-chain vote meets the success criteria defined in the accompanying on-chain poll text.  Rewards The maximum reward for each type of successful proposal is denoted below.  MIP - 2,000 DAI Subproposal - 1,000 DAI Signal - 500 DAI  The reward pool for a given month is split between proposals according to the following weights.  MIP = 1 Subproposal = 1/2 Signal = ¼   Exclusions Proposals concerning collateral onboarding are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Proposals requesting funds from the Maker Protocol are not eligible for off-chain proposal bounties. Core Unit members are not eligible to receive off-chain proposal bounties. This includes Core Unit Facilitators.  Eligible Successful Proposals in November This month we have one successful eligible proposal. Trying to place Maker at the forefront of best practices in DeFi for reliability, integrity, and transparency, Recognized Delegate @nonstopTheo proposed to liquidate MakerDAO’s DAI 1.3 Million of Vaults’ bad debt (Vaults with higher debt than collateral) on its Balance Sheet which stems from disabled liquidations in current active stablecoin Vault Types in the Maker Protocol. The proposal entered the November Governance Cycle and was approved with 82,67% positive votes backed by 64,164 MKR. The proposal will be rewarded with a bounty of 500 DAI. Congratulations to the author! To learn more about the liquidation parameters and auctions activation of these stablecoin vaults please visit this link. Please note that this is a Signal Request submitted to the governance decision during the month of October, prior to the ratification of MIP4c2-SP27: MIP Amendment Subproposal.  November Stats  Polls & Executives In November, twenty-two Governance Polls and four Executive Votes were published to the voting portal.   Governance Proposals Four Mip proposals and nine Subproposals have passed the formal submission window and have entered the Governance Cycle as ratification polls.   November Successful Governance Proposals The following proposals were favorably voted during last month.  MIPs & Subproposals     Type Proposal Author     MIP MIP88: Monetalis - Redwood Friesian @Allan_Pedersen   Subproposal MIP40c3-SP82: Development & UX Core Unit (DUX-001) Budget @0xdeniz   Subproposal  MIP40c3-SP87: Modify the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit Budget (SES-001))  @juanjuan, @wouter, @retro      November Eligible Governance Proposals This month we have not had new eligible governance proposals. If you want to track the course of eligible proposals, you can do so through the Proposal Bounties Tracker.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an introduction to the Off-Chain Proposal Bounties Round-Up initiative, which aims to incentivize concrete and outcome-producing governance proposals by distributing a monthly pool of rewards among the authors of all Signal Requests, MIPs, and Subproposals favorably voted by Maker Governance. The post also provides information on the bounty, eligible proposal types, rewards, exclusions, and successful proposals in November. The post does not contain any negative feedback or collaboration requests.

content.content: Lately I have seen many surveys with little or no sense in several cases, my question is more related to how do you filter them?

We apply different eligibility and exclusion criteria. Eligibility refers to the type of proposals, those are Signals, MIPs, and Subproposals. Then to that universe, we apply the exclusion criteria. These are 3. 1- That the author is not a Core Unit Member or Facilitator, 2- That they are not proposals concerning collateral onboarding, and 3- That they are not proposals requesting funds from the Maker Protocol.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
